intro: Oreocharis rosthornii var. xingrenensis, commonly known as the Xingren oreocharis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool and humid environments. Its flowers are often small and exhibit a range of colors, including white, yellow, and green, which help in attracting specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
